data: ORTHO Post Operative Pain and Symptom Management
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Do not initiate this PowerPlan if Acute Pain Service (APS), Perioperative Pain Service (POPS) or Anesthesiology is following this patient
Patient Care
Order for Duplicate Checking, do not modify
Medications
Celecoxib is contraindicated if patient is allergic to sulpha, NSAID or aspirin, or has cardiac history or renal insufficiency
celecoxib
200 mg, PO, qdaily with food, order duration: 5 day, drug form: cap
For Heterotopic Ossification (HO) Prophylaxis
Indomethacin contraindicated if patient is allergic to NSAID or aspirin or has renal insufficiency
indomethacin
25 mg, PO, TID with food, drug form: cap
acetaminophen
650 mg, PO, QID, drug form: tab
975 mg, PO, QID, drug form: tab
650 mg, NG-tube, QID, drug form: tab
975 mg, NG-tube, QID, drug form: tab
acetaminophen
650 mg, rectal, QID, drug form: supp
TYLENOL #3 EQUIV tab PRN range dose
dose range: 1 to 2 tab, PO, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
oxyCODONE PRN range dose
dose range: 5 to 10 mg, PO, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
HYDROmorphone PRN range dose
dose range: 2 to 4 mg, PO, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
dose range: 1 to 2 mg, PO, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
HYDROmorphone PRN range dose
dose range: 1 to 2 mg, subcutaneous, q4h, PRN prin, drug form: inj
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, subcutaneous, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: inj
dose range: 0.2 to 0.5 mg, subcutaneous, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: inj
dose range: 1 to 2 mg, subcutaneous, q2h, PRN pain, drug form: inj
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, subcutaneous, q2h, PRN pain, drug form: inj
dose range: 0.2 to 0.5 mg, subcutaneous, q2h, PRN pain, drug form: inj
HYDROmorphone PRN range dose
dose range: 0.2 to 0.4 mg, IV, q1h, PRN pain-breakthrough, drug form: inj
dose range: 0.1 to 0.2 mg, IV, q1h, PRN pain-breakthrough, drug form: inj
For Elderly Patients, order lower dose HYDROmorphone below
HYDROmorphone PRN range dose
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, PO, q2h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
HYDROmorphone PRN range dose
dose range: 0.25 to 0.5 mg, subcutaneous, q2h, PRN pain, drug form: inj
morphine PRN range dose
dose range: 2.5 to 10 mg, PO, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: tab
morphine PRN range dose
dose range: 1 to 2 mg, subcutaneous, q4h, PRN pain, drug form: inj
dose range: 1 to 2 mg, subcutaneous, q2h, PRN pain, drug form: inj
morphine PRN range dose
dose range: 0.5 to 1 mg, IV, q1h, PRN pain, drug form: inj
Long Acting
oxyCODONE long acting
10 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab-long acting
20 mg, PO, BID, drug form: tab-long acting
HYDROmorphone long acting
3 mg, PO, BID, drug form: cap-long acting
6 mg, PO, BID, drug form: cap-long acting
morphine (M-ESLON) long acting
10 mg, PO, BID, drug form: cap-long acting
20 mg, PO, BID, drug form: cap-long acting
zopiclone
3.75 mg, PO, qHS, PRN insomnia, drug form: tab
Medications for persistent agitation with risk of harm or injury and confusion assessment method (CAM) positive only
DO NOT order loxapine OR haloperidol in patients with Parkinson's Disease / Lewy Body Dementia
QUEtiapine PRN range dose
dose range: 6.25 to 12.5 mg, PO, q4h, PRN agitation, drug form: tab
loxapine PRN range dose
dose range: 2.5 to 5 mg, PO, q4h, PRN agitation, drug form: tab
loxapine PRN range dose
dose range: 2.5 to 5 mg, subcutaneous, q4h, PRN agitation, drug form: inj
haloperidol PRN range dose
dose range: 0.25 to 0.5 mg, subcutaneous, q2h, PRN agitation, drug form: inj
dose range: 2.5 to 5 mg, subcutaneous, q2h, PRN agitation, drug form: inj
methotrimeprazine PRN range dose
dose range: 2.5 to 5 mg, subcutaneous, q4h, PRN agitation, drug form: inj
naloxone
0.1 mg, IV, q2min, PRN reverse opioid effect, drug form: inj
Sedation Assessment
If Sedation Score (POSS) greater than 3:
Oxygen Therapy
10 L/min if naloxone required and notify treating provider
diphenhydrAMINE
25 mg, PO, q4h, PRN itching, drug form: cap
50 mg, PO, q4h, PRN itching, drug form: cap
diphenhydrAMINE
25 mg, IV, q4h, PRN itching, drug form: inj
50 mg, IV, q4h, PRN itching, drug form: inj
General Nausea Management (Module)
